qas.question: Where did Houston rank for job creation in 2013?
What was Houston the first city to do regain after the recession caused job loss?
How many jobs did Houston add for every one lost?
How many foreign companies relocated to Houston?
On what Forbes list did Houston appear in 2013?

answers.text: Best Places for Business and Careers

qas.question: Where did Houston rank for job creation in 2003?
What was Houston the first city to do regain after the recession caused job boom?
How many jobs did Texas add for every one lost?
How many foreign companies relocated to Texas?

plausible_answers.text: Best Places for Business and Careers

qas.question: On what Forbes list did Houston appear in 2003?

context: In 2013, Houston was identified as the <a0_0><b5_0>#1<b5_0/><a0_0/> U.S. city for job creation by the U.S. Bureau of Statistics after it was not only the first major city to regain all the <a1_0><b6_0>jobs lost<b6_0/><a1_0/> in the preceding economic downturn, but after the crash, more than <a2_0><b7_0>two<b7_0/><a2_0/> jobs were added for every one lost. Economist and vice president of research at the Greater Houston Partnership Patrick Jankowski attributed Houston's success to the ability of the region's real estate and energy industries to learn from historical mistakes. Furthermore, Jankowski stated that "<a3_0><b8_0>more than 100<b8_0/><a3_0/> foreign-owned companies relocated, expanded or started new businesses in Houston" between 2008 and 2010, and this openness to external business boosted job creation during a period when domestic demand was problematically low. Also in 2013, Houston again appeared on Forbes' list of <a4_0><b9_0>Best Places for Business and Careers<b9_0/><a4_0/>.
